analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment and operation of Presidential Commissions, Committees, Councils, or Task Forces. These entities are created to advise the President on various issues, conduct studies, and make recommendations. They are often composed of members from both the public and private sectors, and they operate under the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The commissions cover a wide range of topics, including national security, economic policy, social issues, and government operations.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups: Formation and Function
